title: Winner Performance
description: Data Representation and Analisys using Whoop data
body: Leveraging the capabilities of the WHOOP device and its accompanying application for over a year has provided me with a profound understanding of its potential and the areas ripe for enhancement. In a pursuit to transcend the conventional functionalities, I have harnessed the WHOOP API to architect a web platform that offers innovative interpretations and applications of the data collected. This platform introduces a bespoke scoring system, designed to offer a nuanced alternative to the traditional strain metric. It presents a unique visualisation - a detailed anatomical map highlighting potential areas of soreness, thus providing a more intuitive understanding of physical state post-exercise. Moreover, the site generates personalized reports summarizing the last ten activities, offering users a comprehensive overview of their performance trends and recovery needs. A pivotal feature of this web-based tool is its predictive capability regarding potential illness, employing threshold values to alert users to signs of physical downturn before they manifest into significant health issues. This bespoke approach not only enhances the user experience but also pushes the boundaries of proactive health monitoring. This endeavor represents a sophisticated augmentation of the WHOOP ecosystem, crafted to empower users with more personalized insights and a deeper connection to their physical well-being.

title: Netflix Clone
body:
In this project I created a Clone of netflix main page which I started during the 2020 summer and finished in winter.
This was the project that helped me lay the foundations of React js and other languages ​​such as CSS and HTML, it was a summer project recommended by several friends from the university, with which I learned a lot and had a great time 
 Thanks to this project also learn how to fetch data from APIs and how useful they are.

title: Covid Tracker
body:
Picture this it’s 2020. I just learned about web development and React Js and suddenly COVID-19 strikes, you spend all day in front of the computer for your College assignment and every time you enter Github another COVID tracker pops up. 
 Thanks to this I decided to test my abilities and created this webpage which I couldn’t finish due to lack of time even though the main objective was to work with maps and APIs was successful.
PD: sometimes data doesn’t show on the map because the API is not maintained anymore.

title: Calculator
body:
After a whole year of coding websites, I decided to jump into the App world, so coming from ReactJs the obvious I chose the React Native framework after searching what a good first project I decided to do a Calculator.
 After deciding on the project I started Coding and was ready to start my App development project.
Thanks to this project I feel confident to develop nice apps that are able to run on IOS and Android phones.

title: Spanner App
body:
I was hanging out with my group of friends and we were talking about starting a company together more specifically a Start-Up, and we came up with this App idea.
I am the only Computer Science student in the group so I coded the entire app. The app is finished and we are making all the paperwork necessary for the app to drop legally and be able to handle transactions.
 Thanks to this project I've been able to learn a lot about App development and UX. Taking my skills one step further.
Let’s see how the project evolves

title: Chatter Box
body:
Simple Chat App with whole functionalities: Log In with encripted password, Instant Mesages, pending messages and read functionality. Cool way to learn the basics of WebSockets and how to use them in a real project. 
I also learned how to use JWT and how to use it to authenticate users in a secure way. 
I also learned how to use Kotlin and Springboot to create a backend for the app.
